scenes.text: Quick math hack: multiplying by i rotates a point ninety degrees.
scenes.visualDirection: Flash a complex plane with a single arrow and a bold mapping card: (x,y)->(-y,x).

scenes.text: Think of a point as x plus y i. That is just x and y on a 2D plane.
scenes.visualDirection: Show a dot labeled (x,y) and the text z = x + yi.

scenes.text: Now multiply by i. Watch what happens.
scenes.visualDirection: Bring up (x + yi)i and start highlighting terms.

scenes.text: It becomes negative y plus x i. So x comma y turns into negative y comma x.
scenes.visualDirection: Show derivation and rotate the arrow ninety degrees exactly on the mapping reveal.

scenes.text: That is a perfect ninety degree counterclockwise rotation. No trig required.
scenes.visualDirection: Replay the rotation and stamp 90 degrees counterclockwise.

scenes.text: This is why complex numbers show up in signals, graphics, and rotations.
scenes.visualDirection: Show a waveform and a rotating vector icon briefly.

scenes.text: Want the any angle version next?
